bibl.title: Mastering Matrices and Clusters. Locating Graeco-Roman Settlements in the Meris of Herakleides (Fayum / Egypt) by Monte-Carlo-Simulation.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Building up a matrix. - 3. Monte Carlo Simulation (MCS). - 4. Clustering Results. - 5. Settlement connectivity (5.1. Individual Settlement Connectivity; - 5.2. Source criticism). - 6. Papyrology and cluster: locating settlements (6.1. The northern area: Athribis, Neilou Polis, Philopator Theogenous; - 6.2. The eastern area: Bakchias, Nestou Epoikion, Hephaistias, Philadelpheia, Tanis; - 6.3. The entrance to the Fayum: Haueris, Herakleonos Epoikion, Kerkesoucha Orous, Nabla, Psenharyo, Ptolemais Hormou, Syron Kome; - 6.4. The central part: Arabon Kome, Alabanthis, Aphrodites Berenikes Polis, Boubastos, Letous Polis, Mendes, Persea, Pharbaithos, Sebennytos). - 7. Conclusion. - 8. Appendix: Settlements and Sources.
bibl.seg: MUELLER Katja, Mastering Matrices and Clusters. Locating Graeco-Roman Settlements in the Meris of Herakleides (Fayum / Egypt) by Monte-Carlo-Simulation.
